response.overview: At the beginning of the 20th century, the Žagar family in Notranjska region developed an international timber industry. The timber concern was inherited by young brothers Line and Franci. Line, impressed by the then Soviet idea of ​​a just society, became a communist, while Franci tried to preserve the family fortune. World War II divided the world and also put the Žagar brothers on opposite sides. Eighty years later, Franci's daughters - sisters Monika and Barbara Žagar - explore in the film what happened to their uncle and father. The animated documentary about the Žagar family is a story about the tension between one's own identity and ideology.
response.title: Two Brothers, Two Sisters
